name: Compute (EC2)
description: Amazon EC2 concepts including instance types, pricing models, AMIs, placement groups, Auto Scaling, and Elastic Load Balancing.

name: Object Storage (S3)
description: Amazon S3 storage classes, lifecycle policies, versioning, encryption, durability, and performance optimization.

name: Block & File Storage (EBS & EFS)
description: Amazon EBS volume types, snapshots, performance characteristics, and Amazon EFS use cases and scalability.

name: Databases
description: Database services including RDS, Aurora, DynamoDB, ElastiCache, database selection, scaling, availability, and backup strategies.

name: Networking & Content Delivery
description: VPC design, subnets, routing, security groups, NACLs, Elastic Load Balancing, Route 53 DNS, and CloudFront CDN.

name: Security, Identity & Compliance
description: IAM users, roles, and policies, authentication and authorization, encryption, key management, and AWS compliance concepts.

name: High Availability & Disaster Recovery
description: Multi-AZ architectures, backup and restore, pilot light, warm standby, multi-region designs, and failover strategies.

name: Scalability & Elasticity
description: Horizontal and vertical scaling, Auto Scaling strategies, load balancing, decoupled architectures, and elastic design principles.

name: Application Integration & Messaging
description: Application integration using SQS, SNS, EventBridge, Step Functions, and event-driven architecture patterns.

name: Serverless
description: Serverless architectures using AWS Lambda, API Gateway, event sources, and best practices for scalable serverless design.

name: Monitoring, Logging & Auditing
description: Operational visibility using CloudWatch metrics and alarms, CloudTrail auditing, logging strategies, and troubleshooting.

name: Cost Optimization
description: AWS pricing models, cost allocation, budgets, Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, and cost-efficient architectural decisions.

name: Migration & Hybrid Architectures
description: Cloud migration strategies, AWS Snow Family, DMS, hybrid connectivity, data transfer approaches, and on-prem integration.

name: Well-Architected Framework
description: AWS Well-Architected pillars including security, reliability, performance efficiency, cost optimization, and operational excellence.
